intro: Jussiaea adscendens, commonly known as the ascending Jussiaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Jussiaea adscendens is adapted to aquatic or semi-aquatic conditions, making it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
